models.networkcomponents.algorithms.delaunay

Class Triangulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<Triangle>
        • models.networkcomponents.algorithms.delaunay.Triangulation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Triangle>, java.util.Collection<Triangle>, java.util.Set<Triangle>

    public class Triangulation
extends java.util.AbstractSet<Triangle>
    A 2D Delaunay Triangulation (DT) with incremental site insertion. This is not the fastest way to build a DT, but it's a reasonable way to build a DT incrementally and it makes a nice interactive display. There are several O(n log n) methods, but they require that the sites are all known initially. A Triangulation is a Set of Triangles. A Triangulation is unmodifiable as a Set; the only way to change it is to add sites (via delaunayPlace).
    Author:
    Paul Chew Created July 2005. Derived from an earlier, messier version. Modified November 2007. Rewrote to use AbstractSet as parent class and to use the Graph class internally. Tried to make the DT algorithm clearer by explicitly creating a cavity. Added code needed to find a Voronoi cell.

      • delaunayPlace

        public void delaunayPlace(Pnt site)
        Place a new site into the DT. Nothing happens if the site matches an existing DT vertex.
        Parameters:
        site - the new Pnt
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if site does not lie in any triangle

      • getCavity

        private java.util.Set<Triangle> getCavity(Pnt site,
                                Triangle triangle)
        Determine the cavity caused by site.
        Parameters:
        site - the site causing the cavity
        triangle - the triangle containing site
        Returns:
        set of all triangles that have site in their circumcircle

      • update

        private Triangle update(Pnt site,
              java.util.Set<Triangle> cavity)
        Update the triangulation by removing the cavity triangles and then filling the cavity with new triangles.
        Parameters:
        site - the site that created the cavity
        cavity - the triangles with site in their circumcircle
        Returns:
        one of the new triangles
